name: BEST WESTERN Phoenix Hotel

reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend break in London and at the Pheonix.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Review.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.text: Excellent location, just a short 5 min walk to Bayswater Tube and another 2 mins to Queensway. The hotel is good value for money with breakfast included (Continental) Full english can be bought for an extra £6.50.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Staff all very pleasant and helpful. Very clean rooms and hard but comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shower was great and hot water plentiful.
reviews.title: Really nice stay

reviews.text: I booked this hotel online for a weekend short break. The hotel was very clean , staff friendly and twin bedded room spacious and was looking onto the square....much better than I had been expecting.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: An excellent continental breakfast was provided.
reviews.title: Perfect atmosphere

reviews.text: We have just been there and we will recommend the hotel - especially for a family with teenagers. Queensway. the mainstreet, is both exotic and exiting. If you are tired of central London you can always find a place to eat for all members of the family in this area. You find two tubes, Bayswater and Queensway, and buses nearby.
reviews.title: good value for fair money

reviews.text: For a London hotel a very good deal if you don't want to spend a lot and still wish to avoid a catastrophy. I had a single room that I liked very much with stairs that led to an upper level with the single bed. That was fun, even more as everything was clean and the bed fair enough. Its a few steps to beautiful Hyde Park and in summer you walk through the deep grass into the city centre. Breakfast is basic but ok to start the day with, and the clientele quite nice. I liked this hotel and found places that cost far more less comfortable. good deal and somewhat cozy.
reviews.title: Below average

reviews.text: During WTM (a travel industry event) most hotels are full so as i was flying Emirates booked this hotel through them. While the hotel is beautiful, they mentioned its 19th century, the single room that they provided me was so small. I requested them if they would give me a bigger room. They assured me all rooms were full. So I paid nearly Rs.6000/- (USD135) for the room which i felt was not worth it. Since i had come for an exhibition I had quite a bit of luggage which was hard to fit in the room, and had to keep moving it around.
reviews.title: Meeting with my daughter in LONDON

reviews.text: I selected this hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor and was very pleased with the choice. The hotel is great for the budget traveler. I had a single room, which was small, but that is the norm for hotels in London. My room had a single bed, a TV, a fan, bathroom and electric kettle. The room and the bathroom were extremely clean. The room could use a bit of an update, but for the price I didn't mind. I just needed a place to sleep after spending all day sightseeing.
reviews.title: Good location and good value.

reviews.text: Breakfast was served every morning. My room with Expedia included a continental breakfast which was enough to start the day. Choices included: tea or coffee, toast, croissants, jams and jellies, meat slices and cheese, fresh fruit and juices. For an extra price, you can get an English breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel For Budget Travellers

reviews.text: The location was amazing. I took the Heathrow Connect into Paddington Station for 7.90 GBP. The price is more than 1/2 the price of the Heathrow Express. I decided to travel into the city by the Heathrow Connect because I did not want to lug my luggage up or down the stairs in the 2 nearby Tube stations to the hotel. The walk from Paddington was about 15 minutes - all level and easily done with a wheeled suitcase.
reviews.title: Great location near to Tube stations in west London

reviews.text: The neighborhood was perfect. Looking on the map, it seems to straddle the border of Notting Hill and Bayswater. Lots of good ethnic restaurants in all directions. Down at the corner you will find Whiteley's shopping center. Good restaurants on the 3rd floor. There is a Marks & Spencer on the first floor that has an outstanding food section. So if you want to load up on gourmet sandwiches, drinks, baked goods, etc., for a trip, try here first. In addition, this location of Marks & Spencer also had a clothing section. So if your luggage doesn't show up with you, you can always buy something to tide you over.
reviews.title: Good location, clean and functional, and good vale

reviews.text: The staff at the hotel were always extremely helpful. The housekeeping staff is very hard working.
reviews.title: Everything you need for a short stay

reviews.text: We traveled to London with a large group of family for a wedding. The Phoenix was comfortable for all ages. Ask for a room away from the street, however, because the noise does not stop until well into the night. The breakfast was very good. Rooms were clean and had very modern bathrooms.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as a "last minute" hotel. The original hotel we had booked wasn't exactly what our family had in mind. This hotel had a room available for 4, so we took it. Luckily, the weather wasn't bad...it wasn't too hot. The hotel does not have A/C. We were able to drop our luggage off before check in. The staff was pleasant. Location was fine. We really enjoyed our stay here. Of course, room was smaller than what American's are accustomed to, but it still worked for our family of 4. We would stay there again.
reviews.title: Worked for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 1 night at the Phoenix on 10 July 2010. Paid $122 for a double room with breakfast.
reviews.title: Great location! Staff could benefit from some training...

reviews.text: Excellent location: 30 seconds walk from Queensway street with plenty of shops, restaurants. Two tube stations are 5 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Small room but nice and quiet

reviews.text: Decent continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Great value & pleasantly surprised

description: Conveniently located in central London.Phoenix Hotel is 5 min away from Hyde Park in central London, overlooking one of the capitals famous Garden Squares an area characterized by wonderful shopping and countless international restaurants and traditional English taverns.If you want to get out and about, you'll be within walking distance to two underground stations, Bayswater and Queensway.The hotels location is ideally suited for shopping in Oxford Street, Bond Street and Knightsbridge.The hotel is centrally situated for both the business executive and the holiday-maker, with the West End, its theatres and shops, within very easy reach.
